page.title: 11LANDUSE AND LANDSCAPE
page.content: The landscape around the villages of Highnam and Tibberton is one of undulating farmland.Betwwen the two villages the land rises to a peak of just over 65 metres along a ridge from Rodway Hill southwards through Highnam Woods.The ridge-top site has been used to advantage by the Pinetum.East of the ridge the land is Grade 1 agricultural land producing cereals and oil seed rape in 1985,in large gently sloping fields. The higher,more undulating,land south of Tibberton is characterised by Grade 3 agricultural land with smaller fields and greater emphasis on livestock. Close to Tibberton orchards are significant,whilst the Leadon valley North of Highnam with its poor drainage is given over to pasture.
